comments:
The error received is:

Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
javax/servlet/http/HttpServlet

It tries to start something but that doesn't get through.

Michiel

Which build are you using?
Which JRE, and version are you using?
How are you starting help?
Where is the error displayed?  Log, browser, which frame?
What Linux distribution and version are you using?
Thanks.

Build 2.1 M4
Java version JRE 1.4.1_01-b01
Starting help in --> Help --> Help contents. This does a lot of disk access 
and results in nothing.
All welcome messages in the Eclipse environment work.
Error is displayed on console. Browser does not open at all.
Using mandrake 8.2
Using KDE 2.2.2

Thanks!

Michiel

Did help ever worked on this machine, and is broken broke in M4, or M4 is the 
only one you tried?

Is your classpath clean, i.e. you do not have any j2ee libraries that would 
colide with Tomcat libraries that are part of Eclipse?

Could you also attach full stack trace from the the .log file?

Thanks.

Thank you. Yes I had coliding libs in my jre stuff. Now it works perfectly 
well.
So also the question "Has it worked before?" can be answered with yes.

I'm the stupid user changing stuff without knowing how to do that.
I tried to add all eclipse libs to the jre path to be able to import 
eclipse libs outside eclipse and to be able to access swt inside eclipse.
But at that moment the problem allready was that I used the wrong motif 
version.
(At that time I still had to be convinced to use eclipse)
With the $LD_LIBRARY_PATH that problem was solved. I found out that 
resulted in some collisions as well. But I was too lazy to remove all libs 
from the jre path.

I'm sorry to have disturbed you with something which was completely my 
fault.

Allthough the problem is solved, below is the stack trace from .log in case 
some other people do the same thing.

Thanks very much,

Michiel
